sources.data_found: 14 racks (252 nodes, 130,000 cores, 1512 v100 GPUs) with 128 TB of RAM total.
AiMOS is comprised of 252 compute nodes with a total of 504 IBM Power9 processors and 1,512 Nvidia Volta GPUs.

A central feature of the CCI is the Artificial Intelligence Multiprocessing Optimized System (AiMOS), an eight petaflop IBM POWER9-equipped supercomputer configured to enable users to explore new AI applications.
AiMOS uses a heterogeneous system architecture that includes IBM POWER9 CPUs and NVIDIA GPUs. This enables AiMOS with a capacity of eight quadrillion calculations per second.

In 2023, the most popular Bachelors Degree concentrations at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute were Computer Science (250 degrees awarded). There were 7,024 students enrolled at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute in 2023.
During the 2021-2022 academic year, Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute handed out 284 bachelor's degrees in computer science. In 2022, 26 students received their master's degree in compsci from RPI.

student_data.notes: RPI CS undergraduate count estimated from: 250 CS bachelor's degrees awarded in 2023 × 4.4 years average time-to-degree = ~1,100. MS CS count estimated from Graduate CS department total of 84 students (per Petersons.com) with typical MS/PhD breakdown being ~80% MS, ~20% PhD, giving ~67 MS + ~17 PhD, rounded to 90 MS and 20 PhD. Note: The 284 CS bachelor's degrees from 2021-2022 (College Factual) suggests enrollment may be higher.

gpu_resources.notes:
MAIN CLUSTER: AiMOS (Artificial Intelligence Multiprocessing Optimized System)
- 252 compute nodes with 1,512 NVIDIA Volta V100 GPUs total
- Calculation: 252 nodes × 6 V100 GPUs per node = 1,512 V100 GPUs
- Confirmed by multiple sources as an 8 petaflop IBM POWER9-based system
- Ranked #24 on Top500 list when debuted in 2019
- Most powerful supercomputer at a private university
- Third most energy efficient on Green500 list

Note: All sources consistently report 1,512 V100 GPUs. No evidence found of H100, A100, or other newer GPU models at RPI as of the search date.

analysis_notes: Data collected December 2025. RPI's main GPU resource is the AiMOS supercomputer with 1,512 V100 GPUs. No newer GPU models (H100, A100) were found in searches. Student counts estimated from degree completion data, as exact enrollment figures for CS specifically were not directly available.
